intro: Hypocyrta ciliosa, commonly known as the silky hypocris, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with slender, branching stems that often have a reddish tinge. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, a common floral structure in the Apiaceae family. Hypocyrta ciliosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
